channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tree damaging shed roof, 2nd September
item.description:
The tree in the recreation ground at the bottom of my garden has grown and the branches are now resting on the felt roof of my shed. It is not possible for me to climb up and remove the offending branches as they are too large to cut back and I’m concerned that they will damage the felt on the roof in high winds. Please can you urgently arrange for the tree to be inspected and the overhanging branches to be cut back.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbott's Walk, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hugh mount of leaves and rubbish, 2nd September
item.description:

item.title: Shrubs and trees to be cut back in recreation gound by chatswood mews, 2nd September
item.description:
Trees, shrubs and grass need to be cut back in recreation ground backing onto chatswood mews, this is blocking views to the park and also day/sunlight coming in to the flats there. This is completely blocking the first floors view so needs to be cut back to ground level.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Longlands, London
